moodish.client

Interface MoodishClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MoodishClientDummy

    public interface MoodishClient
    A Moodish client should use a ClientComm interface to communicate with the server.

    When a client connects to the server, it will first receive one CONNECTED message for each user currently connected to the client. The client thus receives information about other clients currently connected to the server when it connects to be able to maintain a list of users online.

    After a client has connected, it can then send Moodish messages (ClientComm.sendMoodishMessage(String)), friendship request (ClientComm.friendship(String)), and unfriendships requests (ClientComm.unfriendship(String)) to the server.

    The client should use ClientComm.getNextMessage() to receive:

    • Moodish messages from other users (type = MOODISH_MESSAGE),
    • notifications about new friendship (type = FRIENDSHIP)
    • notifications about new unfriendship (type = UNFRIENDSHIP)
    • notifications about new clients online (type = CONNECTED )
    • notifications about clients who go offline (type = DISCONNECTED)

    If a client loses its connection to the server, it will not be seeing his/her friends nor will it have any friends even if it reconnects.

    Version:
    1
    Author:
    alc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start(ClientComm clientComm)
      Starts the client and only returns when (if ever) the client is stopped.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(ClientComm clientComm)
        Starts the client and only returns when (if ever) the client is stopped.
        Parameters:
        clientComm - the clientComm through which the client should communicate with the server.
